grants.title: Turbo-Geth
grants.description:
Alternative implementation of Ethereum (Eth 1.x), derived from go-ethereum. The main difference between turbo-geth and go-ethereum is in the way the database is used to store and access the Ethereum state and its history. This change has a profound effect on many parts of the code. Currently, turbo-geth only supports full sync from genesis block, but it will support snapshot sync which is more efficient than fast sync and more secure than warp sync. Turbo-geth is also used as a platform for the research into Stateless Ethereum. More details here: https://ledgerwatch.github.io/Ethereum_1_Research_topics.html#Flat-data-layout-for-storing-the-state
There are currently more than 10 people in the team, working full time and part time.

Latest update on the release status can he found here: https://ledgerwatch.github.io/turbo_geth_release.html
We are currently in alpha, publishing releases every Thursday.

List of current projects can be found here: https://github.com/ledgerwatch/turbo-geth/wiki/Turbo-Geth-(Silkworm)-projects
Document about Past and Future of turbo-geth and Silkworm: https://github.com/AlexeyAkhunov/papers/blob/master/Turbo-Geth-Silkworm.pdf
Document about our architecture plans: https://github.com/AlexeyAkhunov/papers/blob/master/Turbo-Geth-Silkworm-architecture-plans.pdf

grants.title: Commons Stack Community Fund - Panvala League
grants.description:
This is a special Gitcoin grant that is part of the Panvala League Matching Campaign. This grant accepts all donations, but donations in $PAN will receive 5-20x matching!
 
----------------------------

TL;DR

The funds collected in this grant will be distributed to the top 15 Gitcoin Grants from the Commons Stack Community.

🎉See the top grants here: cv.commonsstack.org 🎉

We will report results here when the voting is over.

----------------------------
 
How much does each grant get?

The amount each grant will receive will depend on the funds raised in this grant and matching provided by Gitcoin and Panvala. The distribution is described below in text but it is easier understand by playing with:

💻 this spreadsheet 🤓 


You can increase our $PAN matching in 2 ways! 
 
#1 Donating PAN to this Grant
#2 Philanthropy Mining: Hodling $PAN and Staking to the Commons Stack

Get $PAN to Maximize Matching!

Donate 5 DAI, Gitcoin matches with 10 DAI, Panvala doesn’t match
5 DAI = $15* for this Grant :)

Donate 50 PAN (~5 DAI) Gitcoin matches with 10 DAI Panvala Matches with ~500 PAN
5 DAI worth of $PAN = $65* for this Grant!!! :-D 

*The exact numbers will be figured out at the end of the round, but you can see the difference supporting the Panvala League Grants with $PAN makes.

If you don’t own any $PAN, you can buy some at market price on Uniswap here or buy some using a limit order on Mesa here.
 
Our Community Goals
 
First Goal
 
The Commons Stack’s Trusted Seed community is voting for their top 15 grants and any grant that collected less than $1000 in total funding (donations + matching), excluding the next goals will be topped up to $1000. We estimate this will require ~$5000 worth of funding, but it may take more or less and that will be reflected in the final result.
 
 
Second Goal (Unlocked after ~$5000)
 
If we raise enough to ensure that all the top 15 grants receive at least $1000 in funding, the next $10,000 will be split between the top 5 projects, as voted on by the Trusted Seed. The first place project will get 40% of these funds, 2nd = 30%, 3rd=20%, 4th = 7%, 5th = 3%
 
 
Third Goal (Unlocked after ~$15000)
 
If we raise enough to award the top 5 projects $10,000 in the 2nd goal, the next $10,000 will be split equally to the top 10 projects, as voted on by the Trusted Seed.
 
 
Fourth Goal (Unlocked after ~$25000)
 
If we raise enough to award the top 10 projects $1000 each in the 3rd goal, the next $30,000 will be split equally to the top 15 projects, as voted on by the Trusted Seed. 
 
 
Fifth Goal (Unlocked after ~$55,000)
 
If we raise enough to award all 15 projects with $2000 each in the 4th goal, the rest that we collect will be split between the 15 projects along this rate:
#1-7 = 10% each, #8-12 = 5% each, #13&14 = 2%, #15 = 1%


Donors that support this grant will receive CSTK tokens if their donation is more than 100 DAI (or equivalent value), and they apply to be part of our Trusted Seed.


Thank you for your generosity!
Love, 
The Commons Stack Community

grants.title: The Ethereum 2.0 Annotated Specification
grants.description:
I've made a start on a project to annotate the Ethereum 2.0 specifications, starting with the beacon chain spec.

Quoting from the introduction:

> Welcome to my project to annotate the Ethereum 2.0 specifications!
> As the specs have developed and become formalised over time, a lot
> of the intuition, rationale, explanation and insight has been taken out.
> This is my attempt to put this back in before it's lost forever.

Any of your kind donations received will:
Validate for me that this is worth continuing to spend time on - it is very time consuming.
Enable me to put up bounties to make it more mobile friendly, improve the code colouring, and other usability stuff.
Any surplus to be put towards staking on the beacon chain (as an individual - not in a pool).

Check it out, and if you like what you see, please support this grant!

P.S. To keep the noise down here, I didn't put up a separate grant for eth2.news, but if you appreciate that and would like to contribute, then I'd love you to donate to this one.

grants.description: I find bugs in projects. Sometimes they're running on mainnet. Sometimes there's a lot of money at stake. If you want to support me and my research, this is one of the best ways to do it.

grants.title: Ethereum Push Notification Service (EPNS)
grants.description:
Missing piece of Web3 is here ⚡! EPNS is a decentralized Protocol for sending notifications. Get notified from dApps / smart contracts on mobile, web browser or user wallets. Did we mention you as a user also earns from them!? Cause why not ;).



We believe that Notifications are a basic necessity for any dApps / smart contracts / web3 services that truly want to build a better web3 and for that to happen, a decentralized communication layer needs to be built... one that provides equal opportunities to all dApps to send notifications to their users, which follows web3 ethos and is capable of carrying these notifications to any platform including crypto wallets, mobile apps or even web browsers.


What is Ethereum Push Notification Service?
EPNS is a decentralized DeFi notifications protocol which enables users (wallet addresses) to receive notifications. 

Using the protocol, any dApp, smart contract or service can send notifications to users(wallet addresses) in a platform agnostic fashion (mobile, web, or user wallets). The DeFi aspect of the protocol also ensures that the user receives and earns from those notifications.


But why Notifications?
Blockchain still operates like the early era of the internet where you logged in to Gmail to check if a new email had come or went to Orkut to see what your friends wrote about you (yes, we are that old). But that is not the norm today, services don’t expect users to come to them, instead they notify the users. That is the missing piece of the blockchain ecosystem which EPNS aims to provide. 

Check us out!
Website — https://epns.io
Twitter — https://twitter.com/epnsproject
Telegram — https://t.me/epnsproject
Medium — https://medium.com/@epnsproject
Repo — https://github.com/ethereum-push-notification-system

grants.title: BrightID 🔆 Universal Proof of Uniqueness
grants.description:
BrightID is thrilled to be working with Gitcoin to reduce the impact of Sybil accounts.

For round seven, we’re using “verification parties” as the primary way to help people get verified as unique and receive the bonus match. To participate, users must download the BrightID app.

Help us raise $20,000 this round to build a more flexible and transparent integration with Gitcoin. Our goal is that you could get verified using normal Gitcoin social interactions without having to download a separate app. Your uniqueness verification will exist in identity wallets of your choice (including MetaMask with 3ID from 3Box). We will conform to emerging decentralized identity standards, including decentralized key management and the new “Universal Wallet” standard.

We look forward to many more integrations.

BrightID is building an identity lego that allows users to prove to applications that they only exist once in any given system.

What if you could always prove you were a real unique user?

It is easy in the real world to ensure you are dealing with a unique or a specific person, but imagine how many systems could be improved or made possible if every user and/or account could prove that they only exist once as we transition to the digital era?
* Digital voting and governance - including quadratic voting, liquid democracy, and signaling
* Truly universal income or airdrop distributions payable to literally everyone
* Public-goods funding allocation - trust minimized and collusion resistant thanks to MACI
* Social media without millions of bots polluting the discourse
* Credit systems for under-collateralized DeFi
* And so much more...

Some amazing projects are already integrating with BrightID:
* Gitcoin – funding public goods and open-source software
* CLRfund – permissionless quadratic funding
* 1Hive – organizes and builds communities – faucet distributes free honey 🍯
* HedgeForHumanity – distributing value fairly to all of humanity
* BurnSignal – quadratic signaling method for Ethereum 🔥🧧
* WhalerDAO - Building systems that make it profitable for people and protocols to do good. 🐳
* Will your project be next?

How does it work?
BrightID is creating a giant pseudonymous social graph of people all around the world. Users can make private, cryptographically secure connections to people they know, using a smartphone app. This pseudonymous connection data is shared among a decentralized group of computer nodes that store and analyze the public social graph. The nodes of the network determine and verify the likely uniqueness of each account, based on its interconnectivity with other accounts. The user can then use their brightID verification to prove to any integrated system that they have one and only one account. The potential integrations are endless.
 
We are a DAO!
Check our Aragon’s great description.
 
BrightID is committed to being an open source and decentralized project. We have created the BMAIN DAO (powered by Aragon) to act as a steward for this important public commons. You can learn more about our DAOs here. 100% of contributed funds will go to the DAO.
 
Come help us build a brighter world. 🔆

grants.title: Nethermind
grants.description:
Gitcoin Grants Round 7 is happening now. We want to take some time to thank our supporters - with your help we have been able to:

Replace the int256 library with a native C# lib (with help from cardinals.cc)
Complete work on Beam Sync Wallet, our PoC for a desktop dashboard without Infura connection and with mainnet txs in 5 minutes. Check out the beta version: https://docs.nethermind.io/nethermind/nethermind-utilities/beam-wallet
Improve performance of all our precompiles
Translate our website and documentation to Chinese: https://docs.nethermind.io/nethermind/v/chinese/
Help to deliver Baseline BRI-1: https://docs.baseline-protocol.org/bri/overview-of-reference-implementations
Greatly expand Nethermind testing support for the great Ethereum Test team (still some Hive fixes missing)

Other things we are continuing to work on, for which your continued support is appreciated:
Kovan support (you can already fast sync it)
Pruning (almost ready!)
EIP-1559 Implementation (we are also promised $24k contribution towards this effort by @etherealCapital ! (thank you!)
We are planning to replicate the turbo database formats / sync mechanisms in case they work well (TurboNeth / Project Cocoon)

We have received separate grants / payments for our contributions to chains like EWF and xDAI - everything that you contribute on Gitcoin grants goes towards mainnet testing and improvements.

Follow along on our blog and socials to keep updated with all the latest news and announcements:

https://nethermind.io

Medium: https://medium.com/nethermind-eth 

Newsletter Signup: http://nethermind.io/newsletter

Twitter — https://twitter.com/nethermindeth

LinkedIn — https://www.linkedin.com/company/nethermind

GitHub --- https://github.com/NethermindEth/nethermind 

Discord — https://discord.gg/XUz8Bd

Gitter — https://gitter.im/nethermindeth/nethermind


Nethermind's flagship product is a superfast and comprehensive Ethereum 1.x client. We also build a decentralized marketplace that can serve as an Infura decentralizer (without excluding Infura!) and a great tool for DeFi data streams and reports. The project was bootstrapped in 2017 and then received an Ethereum Foundation grant in August 2018 to deliver the full client implementation. All our products work directly on Ethereum mainnet and use native ETH + DAI. The team remains loyal to Ethereum with heart and mind.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=M958HYCJ9X4

grants.title: The Commons Stack: Iteration 0
grants.description:
Funding open-source projects & other public goods is the killer app of blockchain tech. Giveth & BlockScience have joined forces to build the Commons Stack: a modular library of well-engineered components that create economic designs for creating sustainable funding to Public Goods projects. There is value in Public Goods and we are confident economies can be built to incentivize the creation of this value. 

UPDATES

We have several projects ongoing at the moment.

Our main focus is supporting the Token Engineering community in creating the first Commons, the Token Engineering Commons! Which also has it's own grant. Join the TE Discord to follow the progress.
We also are working with our own community to build the Commons Simulator, a game that shows the power of cadCAD to parameterize economic systems and their governance.
We are proud of the 3 Conviction Voting pilots that are live, thanks to 1Hive! We have our own CV pilot which will be helping to allocate $170,000 worth of $PAN on Gitcoin via the Commons Stack Community Fund.   

We have started using Github/Zenhub to track our work in detailed issues. If you want to see what we are up to, or even help us take on a few of these issues, we are very open to the idea ;-)

We are looking to expand the team! If you know any Project Managers, Communication Leads, or Community Managers, have them send their resumes to info [at] commonsstack.org

Funding Iteration 0

Donations to this grant will go to supporting the core functions and responsibilities of the Commons Stack. We will be using these donations to map out our deliverable roadmaps and budgets for each project, expand our communications, confirm our legal strategy, grow the Trusted Seed, and do all the other work we need to do to champion the Commons Stack! 

We have open accounting! All funds raised will be spent transparently in our Iteration 0 Campaign on the Giveth DApp. 

Our Plan

Our primary goal is to enable sustainable funding for any nonprofit cause. In the near term, we will focus on enabling economies that can create sustainable funding for the development of open-source infrastructure and open research projects within the blockchain space. To achieve this we will provide a toolkit for communities to create novel, cause-focused economies that we call Commons. 

To build a successful Commons, or any other socio-economic system, a community must consider both the technical and cultural requirements. The Commons Stack mission is to make it easy for cause-focused communities to meet and excel at these requirements so that they can launch a healthy Commons.

On the Technical side we want to:

1. Support cadCAD: We want to create and fund an independent team to manage the open-source development of cadCAD.

2. Simulate our Components: We want to validate the design of all the Commons components by building open-source, modular cadCAD models that can be forked and applied to other crypto projects.

3. Build our Components: We want to work with various development teams in the space to build modular DApps that can be customized for each Commons component’s parameterization including the Augmented Bonding Curve and Conviction Voting modules. 

4. Iterate our Components: We have an iterative build strategy, building Commons with a focus on one core component at a time, and then incorporating improvements into successive iterations. The first iteration will focus on the Augmented Bonding Curve. The second iteration will focus on the Giveth Proposal Engine while also advancing the ABC component, and so on. 

On the Cultural side we want to:

1. Grow the Trusted Seed: Starting any project is aided greatly by having people on your side who have done it before. The Trusted Seed is a curated community of prosocial Commons “experts” that will learn how Commons work and can be trusted to seed many future Commons with their expertise. This is the primary focus of Iteration 0.

2. Maintain a How to DAO Wiki: A Commons is simply a cause-focused DAO with a well designed economic framework. Many DAOs have succeeded and failed in the last few years and we want to create and collect case studies that can be used to derive a list of best practices that can help all DAOs learn from the past to build a successful future. 

3. Support Commons’ Cultural Build: Before any code is written, communities need to ensure they have strategies for following Ostrom’s 8 principles and develop their culture in a way that lends itself to successfully using our tech. This is the Focus of the Token Engineering Commons.

4. Create a Cultural Playbook: For the Commons to become widespread, the Commons Stack Core team cannot become a bottleneck. Our Commons Cultural Playbook will document how to successfully complete a Commons Cultural Build.


Tracking your Support

Donors that support this grant will receive CSTK tokens if their donation is more than 100 DAI (or equivalent value), and they apply to be part of our Trusted Seed.

grants.title: Rotki - The portfolio tracker and accounting tool that protects your privacy
grants.description:
What is Rotki?

Rotki is an open source portfolio tracking, accounting, analytics and tax reporting tool that protects your privacy.

The mission of Rotki is to bring transparency into the crypto and financial sectors through the use of open source. Most importantly unlike virtually every other competing service which consists of closed source SaaS onto which you are forced to hand over all your financial data, with Rotki your data is stored encrypted locally in your computer. It enables you to take ownership of your financial data.

Why a Gitcoin Grant?

We are using this Gitcoin grant to attempt to partially fund the development of the project. Funding opensource work is a hard problem and we want to try what Gitcoin can do towards alleviating that problem. Especially since we currently have a ton of feature requests (https://github.com/rotki/rotki/issues) and we are but 2 people working on it full-time. The project is at the moment self-funded. Proper funding would change that and allow us to get more developers and better infrastructure to provide better experience for our users.

Results of Grants round 6

We want to sincerely thank all the people who contributed to the 5th Gitcoin grant CLR round!
Thanks to your 3000 DAI and the 2507 DAI matched by the CLR we managed to gather about 5500$. It's not a sustainable amount to keep us going for 3 months (the amount of time between the CLR rounds) but it's still a great help. Especially considering we were the 10th top grant of the tech round.
Thank you!

What have we achieved since then?

Gitcoin grants round 6 ended in the start of July 2020. In about 2 months we took your trust in us earnestly and have managed to do a lot of things!

A small summary of the post follows here:
Released rotki v1.6.0, a huge update which contained:
A whole new look for the rotki UI.
Support for aave protocol balances and lending history
An overview of user's holdings over multiple DeFi protocols.
ENS support when inputting addresses for tracking.
...and more. For dull details check the release notes.
Released rotki v1.6.1 which contained:
Improvements for Ubuntu users
Fixes a breaking bug
...and more. For full details check the release notes.
Released rotki v1.6.2 which contained:
Ability to specify addresses to be queried per DeFi protocol and which DeFi protocols to query. Saves a lot of time during historical balance querying.
Removed Fiat Balances in favor of manually tracked balances.
New more robust way of detecting user owned tokens. Alethio is no longer used.
Ability to purge exchange and ethereum data cached in the DB.
...and more. For full details check the release notes.
Released rotki v1.7.0 which contained
Users can now explore their ethereum transactions.
Users can now explore their exchange+manual trades.
Users can now explore their deposit/withdrawals to/from exchanges.
Yearn finance vaults and curve pools are now automatically tracked across all accounts
New icons for all supported assets!
Crypto.com mobile app import supported
Customization of number displays
...and a lot more. For full details check the release notes.

Why should you contribute?

To help us keep developing an opensource tool that supports your privacy.
We plan to integrate with most of the major DeFi platforms available today in the network.

That is:
Compound lending and borrowing (Coming very soon v1.8.0)
Yearn finance vaults historical accounting (Coming very soon v1.8.0)
Support uniswap exchange trades
... and more (if you have any suggestions please contact us in discord/telegram/twitter -- links below)

If you like what we are doing and want to help us achieve our mission you can donate as much you want via this Grant. Even 1 DAI counts, if it's happening during the CLR round thanks to the fund matching mechanism.

All funds we get from this grant will go towards development of ethereum features for Rotki. Either those outlined above or others that you request of us.

Help us create software that will enable you to take ownership of your financial data!

Other ways to help us

Did you contribute? Thank you so much!!!
Did you not contribute yet? Still thank you for your interest and for reading so far.

In either case there are many other ways to help us:
You can buy a premium subscription and unlock premium only features here: https://rotki.com/products/
You can star our Github repo: https://github.com/rotki/rotki
Use the app daily and spread the word. Tell your friends about it.
Become a contributor to Rotki. We welcome newcomers who want to work on awesome opensource software. If you are able to code in Python, Typescript and vue.js please check our Github and get in touch with us.
Give us feedback by creating Github issues.
Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/rotkiapp
Join our chatrooms. Telegram: https://t.me/rotkichat Discord: https://discord.gg/aGCxHG7

Stay in touch and get more info

Read more in our website: https://rotki.com/
Check our github: https://github.com/rotki/rotki/
Read our blog: https://blog.rotki.com/
Follow us on twitter: https://twitter.com/rotkiapp
Chat with us in discord: https://discord.gg/aGCxHG7
Chat with us in Telegram: https://t.me/rotkichat

grants.title: RadicalxChange Foundation is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization for next-generation political economies.
grants.description:
RadicalxChange (RxC) is a global movement for next-generation political economies. RxC advances plurality, equality and community, through upgrades of democracy, markets, property rights, the data economy, the commons and collective intelligence governance.
 
Founded by E. Glen Weyl in the wake of public discussion about the publication of his book Radical Markets in 2018, the RadicalxChange Foundation is a non-profit organization dedicated to that cause.

RxC connects people from all walks of life - ranging from social scientists and technologists to artists and activists. The movement is ever evolving and always welcoming new people and ideas to make our social world more diverse, equal, and free.

RXC CONCEPTS
Common Partial Ownership - Data Dignity - Intersectional Identity - Quadratic Funding and Voting - Radical Antitrust

The ideas inspiring the RadicalxChange movement have their roots in the book Radical Markets – but they are by no means limited to them. Instead, they grow and evolve, based on new research, feedback from the community, and what we learn from trying these ideas out in the real world.

NETWORKED CONVERSATIONS
RadicalxChange brings public conversations about democracy, markets, and our shared values into the 21st century.
Conferences help develop a powerful global network of forward-thinking, bold, and responsible policymakers, entrepreneurs, and intellectuals.
Various audio and video formats help spread the word about RxC concepts and reach a wider audience.
Social media channels help to connect with a broad public, not just academics and policymakers.

See past conference sessions on our YouTube channel or tune into the RxC Replayed podcast.

GITXCHANGE2: QUADRATIC FUNDING HACKATHON
The Quadratic Funding Hackathon is a program designed by RadicalxChange Foundation and Gitcoin to lay the ground for a variety of Quadratic Funding ecosystems. Quadratic Funding is a new form of matching funding that democratically incentivizes contributions to public and shared goods and services. It optimizes matching funds by prioritizing projects based not on the size but on the number of individual donations.

We believe that Quadratic Funding can advance public goods of all kinds. It is a radical mechanism that reflects the needs of all members in diverse communities. The hackathon opens the floor to all the communities that want to follow and experience this philosophy.

The hackathon includes a variety of bounties on Quadratic Funding. It brings together creative companies, non-profits, governments, and individuals, who would like to incentivize more democratic public goods governance in the context of their cause.

(Here, you can explore the prizes from the first GitxChange. That one had a broader focus on hacks for all RxC concepts.)

LOCAL ACTION, GLOBAL IMPACT
Find an RadicalxChange chapter in your region / organization or start your own.
 
Uproot coordination and cooperation in your local community with the Handbook for Local Radical Democracy. 

Unite with your peers and enforce the Data Freedom Act. 

Browse our literature list for thought-provoking reads in the park.

DIRECTIONS
Moving forward, we are working on a variety of projects to strengthen the RxC movement.
Regularly scheduled livestreams
Conversations podcast series
Democratization of RxC Foundation governance
RxC Fellowship program
Arts exhibition pdf
3rd annual conference

TOGETHER, BUILDING MARKTES AND TECHNOLOGY TRUER TO THE RICHNESS OF OUR DIVERSELY SHARED LIVES.

grants.title: DAppNode - Panvala League
grants.description:
The PANVALA League Donations

DAppNode is decentralized infrastructure. As such, many other project can be built on top of it. But how can we allocate funds and efforts to these projects who are part of the DAppNode ecosystem? The answer is: the community can - not us. The users, the builders, those contributing and participating to create a better, more useful DAppNode should be encouraged to do so. So all the PAN contributions to this Gitcoin Grants round and its matching will go straight back to this community, with the vision that a stronger community and more projects working on top of DAppNode are what will increase the utility, usability and ultimately determine the success of the project. 

First Goal (500$ - 3,500$) 

The DAppNode community is evolving. In order to support this growth and reward the most active community members, our first goal will be directed towards a community treasury to reward the best contributions.
This community treasury will be based on Sourcecred and will be ignited with the money received from this grant round. The donations will be used as the seed funds to distribute among the most active members of the community, who later can decide to stake into our cluster (and generate a virtuous circle) or cash out. 
These people represent the most active and participative users in the DappNode community, those who help other members with support, those who contribute with ideas or those who build on top of DAppNode. 

Second Goal (above 3500$)

Anything above the seed fund will be donated to other projects, with the purpose of creating DAppNode packages of their products. By creating a scheme of Package Champions that will steward the maintenance of the package and of Package Developers, who will create the actual DNPs, we will be donating to projects that have demonstrated interest in integrating with DAppNode: Rotki, Trueblocks, BrightID... and packages that the community members have requested: ETH2.0 validation tools, other PoS networks... The community will decide!

DAppNode is the Decentralized Infrastructure of the Web3

Contributing to DAppNode's grant is to contribute to a fully decentralized vision of the blockchain ecosystem: 
We want to enable decentralized infrastructure for the world by shifting the value captured by the cloud giants to the participants at the edges, destroying the barriers of entry for participation: that is, to enable anyone to get paid by maintaining the infrastructure of the internet.

We have identified two tracks that will stimulate decentralization in the short to mid term and we will dedicate 1/2 of the Grant to each of the tracks: 

1- Knowledge, dissemination and creation of TRUE DApps.
2- Ethereum 2.0 validation. 

Most DApps are not decentralized. Nobody is to blame for that: To begin with, DApps need access to nodes to work: that means either become a centralizing vector yourself and maintain your own node at a considerable cost and headache, or go to another player that does that at scale and is more efficient but also has more power over the data - Infura or other Node-as-a-Service providers. A DApp developer does not necessarily want to be an infrastructure provider, so it’s just normal that it would pay someone to do so. 

Secondly, DApps need to be as usable and accessible as any other app - which means that they need to go through the distribution channels users are used to: a website, an app store, etc. Considering that accessing decentralized websites requires extra steps from the user (like using an IPFS gateway to access decentralized front-ends, for example), and we want to make it easier for her, it is just easier to use a standard hosting service that most likely ends up in AWS, GC or Azure.

So... have we lost the decentralization war to an inevitable but insidious prioritization exercise?

It doesn’t have to be. Let open source come to the rescue. We will spend half of the Gitcoin Grant Round 5 on Gitcoin Bounties targeted at decentralizing commonly used DApps, and the other half on ETH2.0 research (more on that later). 

How are we going to use Bounties to create a more truly decentralized ecosystem?
Reward DApps to maintain their own decentralized front end (IPFS/.eth domain)
Reward Developers to include the option for users to connect to their own node (it’s unbelievable how this is NOT a default in all DApps!)
Reward Developers to create DAppNode packages of their DApps.
Reward Open Source contributors to develop and maintain packages, (like Nate Gentile’s light & local block explorer). 

The second half of the grant will be spent on what has the potential to decentralize the Ethereum network, if done correctly: Eth2.0 and its openness for validation. We hope that DAppNode will be the easiest way to deploy and maintain a validator with minimal effort! But in order to future-proof this 

All of this, free and open source. Get your DAppNode at install.dappnode.io or get your plug-and-play hardware solution at shop.dappnode.io.



Consensys Grants final report: 
DAppNode is the easiest way to run decentralized infrastructure. Install our Free (& Gratis) Open Source Software, a couple of clicks and boom, you’re running a local node of whatever network you want to support. No technical knowledge needed and even less if you get the plug-and-play hardware from our shop! Plug to your router, you’re game. 
We’ve devoted a lot of work to make every piece of it completely decentralized. Using it will never require you to connect to a central server (because DAppNode is a fat client and self-contains Ethereum and IPFS nodes, it connects directly to these decentralized networks!). We even created a decentralized auto-update system so infrastructure maintenance is even more hands-free. 

The thesis is decentralization empowers people (with sovereignty over their own data, with access to unstoppable services). The antithesis is only a few have the technical knowledge to be empowered this way. The synthesis is DAppNode breaks down all technical barriers for everyone to participate in this decentralized networks. 
And it works! Promise is fulfilled and we are working every day to make it more user-friendly, easier to understand and to maintain and bring the world closer to an ideal where there are no cloud providers and everyone can participate into a crypto-network that helps them offer their hardware to an infrastructure protocol (or several) and get rewarded for it. 
Ah, but there was a use case that we couldn’t figure out. Let’s hear it through the story of our type user, Paco:

Paco is privacy-conscious. He doesn’t want his data floating around but also he doesn’t want anyone’s data floating around so it can be used on them at every election by the myriad of Cambridge Analytica spin-offs. He sees that as a threat to democracy. Hence he sees the value of decentralization through blockchains: protocols that only keep the data they need on-chain and users know in advance which data that is; or protocols that store information in a way that can be accessed without being recorded and in an unstoppable and uncensorable way. 
Paco is tech-savvy, compared to most, but not a developer nor comfortable with command line. He’s an early adopter of tech. He got excited by Bitcoin’s promise of a decentralized pseudonymous digital currency in the early days, and that’s how he got into crypto. He uses Signal as his main messaging app. He uses DAppNode to run an Ethereum node and a Monero node and regularly experiments with new projects thanks to DAppNode’s ever-growing list of packages. 
He transacts happily, broadcasting the transactions through his own nodes, accessing .eth domains through his local IPFS node. But he can only do so when he’s at home, next to his DAppNode.
If he wants to do a transaction when he’s at the office, or at a cafe, or at the hotel during a business trip, he has no way to connect to his node because his home connection has a Dynamic IP that keeps changing so he has no way to find it. 

Alright Paco, this is a hard problem but we gotchu. We have created a DNS server so your DAppNode will have a public address that you can look for and in the background it will update with its new IP. Not ideal, we know, but we collect no data from this server. “Decentralize till it hurts, centralize until it works”!
This was the only compromise. In the name of UX and serving users, there was that DNS server! But, could we fully decentralize our solution? Is there a way to create a Decentralized Dynamic DNS? Enter Consensys Grants. 
Milestone 1. Codename “D” for Decentralized and “D” for Dynamic
Well it turns out it is possible. We analyzed different protocols like ZeroNet, Swarm FEEDS and libp2p and decided that probably the best way to go for this use case was libp2p. ZeroNet and Swarm FEEDS could be used, but they either had too much overhead or they would require a radical change on sizeable parts of DAppNode’s codebase. 
At the end of Milestone 1 we had a libp2p PoC that allowed two machines to discover each other in the vast internets, connect securely and start exchanging. See the video in milestone 2 for more information (the full DDDNS works according to the same principles as the PoC). 
Milestone 2. Codename “DDDDDDDDDDDDDDDNS”. Ok, that’s too many D’s. Call D cops.  
Objective was to create a working system that could scale and could be implemented in DAppNode or other projects in need of a similar solution. 
What better way to show it than with a video?
https://youtu.be/YsKhGEbucnc
Milestone 3. Codename “DDDeploy”. We were running out of ideas for names 🤷
Milestone 3 was to deploy it in our production version of DAppNode so Paco would be able to use it to connect to his RPC endpoints from wherever, leveraging only decentralized systems. 
DAppNode’s DDDNS system is not in production yet. DNSs are such a deeply ingrained part of the internet that it’s hard to just replace it. Unless we want to reinvent the wheel, which would take a lot more work, we depend on other actors integrating with our system. The good news is that thanks to Open Source, we have identified how it could integrate with WireGuard’s VPN so a user would be able to open a VPN tunnel from the client to their DAppNode using our system. 
So now we are in the process of integrating it as an internal system of discovery for DAppNodes to communicate with each other, which will enable things like federations or peer monitoring.
 
Most of the questions for the final report have been addressed above. Let’s directly respond to those which haven’t:

In your opinion, what is the most remarkable accomplishment or finding of your project?
This project has been a journey of discovery. We stumbled upon protocols that amazed us by their cleverness, and experimented with amazing tech. But the single most remarkable finding keeps being the astounding potential of Open Source. We could test, iterate, modify different approaches and basically build on the shoulders of giants. Every line of code we tested is a reflection of a design goal and a technological and even philosophical approach. While this is not a surprise to anyone, we feel that in the time where Open Source public goods are struggling to find its place or ensure its survival, it is worth highlighting how much progress can be made thanks to them. 

To what extent did this work contribute to the greater open source ethereum community.
Ever wanted a way to connect two machines in a completely decentralized way? To serve from your server to a client without having to register in any DNS? Have a look at that, it’s for everyone to use: https://github.com/dappnode/DDDNS

Last but not least, we want to thank the Consensys Grants team for everything that they have made for the Grantees. We have received opportunities to promote our product, to receive feedback on investment pitches, to learn about other projects, to get in touch with different teams at Consensys, to easily access Consensys products and consensys-backed products with discounts or “grantee” treatment… We felt accompanied throughout and we felt a genuine attempt to help us in any way possible. This was clearly the best part of the grant.

grants.title: ArchiveNode.io - The Public Access Ethereum Archive Node
grants.description:
Hey there!

ArchiveNode.io is an initiative by Hunter (DeFi Dude) and Chase (MysticRyuujin) to create an easy way to access archive node data on Ethereum.

Originally Hunter realized the barrier to running an archive node on Ethereum (5TB+ in SSD space!) and wanted to do something about it, but didn't know enough to really get anything done.

From that point he reached out to Chase as well as the Ethereum Foundation, Chase because he is a node and networking mastermind, and Ethereum Foundation because a grant was needed to get things off the floor.

After some time the EF had agreed to offer us a very generous grant in AWS credits, allowing us to spin up an archive node in the cloud to offer users. This was better than nothing at first, but was burning through over $800+ a month alone in credits - so we knew it wasn't sustainable.

From that point, Dan from PieDAO had reached out and kindly offered to sponsor us the money to run 1-2 more archive nodes/month, still in the cloud - but luckily not with AWS so it was magnitudes cheaper.

This was very generous and to this day Dan is still supporting our project as a whole (with the AWS credits on the backburner), but once again, this is not sustainable, and we cannot rely on Dan to pay our bills.

We are creating this grant in hopes to deploy physical hardware capable of supporting archive nodes.

The ideal setup would be to have us running at least two physical hardware nodes operating out of separate locations. The second for redundancy. This puts our operating costs to a minimum (only electricity) and also allows for the project to remain much more sustainable in the future.

So, what is the purpose of ArchiveNode.io?

We want to benefit the Ethereum community by offering developers and the likes access to archive nodes for education, development, research, whatever - without having to break the bank. Right now, they're looking to pay upwards of ~$1,500+ (more if they expect redundancy) for an archive node, otherwise they have the option of paying Infura $250/month. We realize this isn't right, nor affordable for small time devs - which is the purpose we serve.

We charge nothing for a developer to utilize our archive nodes.

To date, we have received over 100 requests for archive node access, majority of which have been accepted.

We would very much appreciate any and all support on our grant, in hopes to fund physical hardware for our project!

Thank you.

grants.title: Snapshot
grants.description:
Snapshot is an off-chain gasless multi-governance client with easy to verify and hard to contest results.

✅Creating a proposal and voting is free no transaction
✅Proposals and votes are just signed messages stored on IPFS 
✅Signatures are easily verifiable online they use the "eth_sign" format 
✅We don't have any token or business model, and no plans to get one
✅It's free to create a space it take 5mn to add one
✅Space can have their custom domain name 
✅Space can have their own skin 
✅Space can have custom strategies to calculate results 
✅Fully open source with MIT license 
✅We don't use any tracking or ads in our site

⭐100% of the funds will be sent to contributors of the project (Fabien @bonustrack excluded)
⭐We will not spend any fund on marketing
⭐All the fund we receive and transfer we do are visible here: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1pjmYpvt-vIh_x-lVMdfJBYloWNbA9V35HW0WmOG-XZg
⭐If you donate, you will get a collector Snapshot POAP badge (we will distribute it in the end of the Gitcoin round 7)

grants.title: DeFi Dad DeFi Tutorials on YouTube and Twitter
grants.description:
Having been in the Ethereum community over 3 years, I began experimenting with DeFi apps over a year ago. I had traded on centralized exchanges the last few years but having been in SaaS before entering crypto, I was accustomed to doing daily product demos for clients.

By 2019, I decided to start sharing my own journey dogfooding everything DeFi to prove that more should be trying DeFi, in light of the huge benefits of a censorship-resistant p2p finance system that requires no KYC, no minimum funds, and has no geo restrictions.


Since Gitcoin Grants Round 6, here's the results of my free educational DeFi content and how I used Round 6 funds:

My Twitter account where I post daily DeFi tips and tutorials, is now 3.5 million impressions per month.
My YouTube channel DeFi Tutorials with DeFi Dad has attracted over 11,000 subscribers, with over 196,000 views in just the last 90 days.
I've produced 28 videos over 90 days just on my channel (which is 1 video every 3 days).
I've produced an additional 24 Bankless Tutorials the past ~24 weeks for Bankless YouTube. Add both channels together, I average a video every 1.5 days.
I've also produced countless DeFi tutorials for The Defiant, and often write on fundamentals of DeFi.
I used the Round 6 funds i) to pay a designer to brand my YouTube channel and create a logo for DeFi Tutorials with DeFi Dad, ii) buy a very powerful MacBook Pro for better video editing, and iii) lots of gas I've blown test driving DeFi apps.

So here's what's next and how I will use Round 7 funding to produce more public goods for the community:

I will use part of the proceeds to pay for this new powerful MacBook Pro I recently bought in light of the improved video editing I'm doing.
I will likely use part of the money to continue subsidizing the insane amount of gas I pay to test drive DeFi apps in my videos.
I will continue to create even higher quality content since self-teaching myself to use iMovie by using Adobe Premiere or Final Cut Pro ($299/year).
I am finally launching a DeFi Dad Podcast and will use funds to pay for some simple expenses to produce the podcast.
As I've stated in the past, I spend about 5 hours a day, 7 days a week, curating and producing DeFi content outside of my day job working now for Zapper. Whatever you want to value my time at, I'd appreciate any funding from the community since I spend that limited time devoted to Ethereum and DeFi content, while raising 2 young kids.

Thank you for considering me and even if you don't donate, please follow me at @DeFi_Dad on Twitter and subscribe to the DeFi Tutorials with DeFi Dad YouTube channel!

grants.title: WalletConnect
grants.description:
WalletConnect is an open protocol for connecting desktop Dapps to mobile Wallets using end-to-end encryption by scanning a QR code. Opening up a whole world of Dapps that were once only available to Metamask. The user can interact with any Dapp without comprising their private keys and will be notified to sign any transaction requests on their mobile. Looking to use the funds from this grant to payout Gitcoin bounties to speed up the development of the native mobile libraries for Android and iOS and also to create a multi-wallet web3-provider to handle both Metamask and WalletConnect in one pop-up modal/widget for Dapp developers. Additionally there are plans to include built-in support for meta-transactions, delegate key signing and smart contract wallets.
 
walletconnect.org

grants.title: CrypCade Entertainment Systems
grants.description:
CrypCade.io Entertainment Ecosystem is a Competitive Risk to Skill Ecosystem Using cutting edge technology to bring one of a kind experiences.

CrypCade is an ecosystem, which strives and differentiates by acting as both HOST and DEVELOPER of Game Dapps. Aiming to allow users seamless connectivity and enjoyment in our Entertainment Systems Platforms.
CrypCade is a revolutionary redesign on old arcades, “casinos” and “gaming platforms”.

Launched on the Tron Network and now integrating into the Matic.Network , our “Patent Pending” designs and multi functionality on the platform, ensure a kind of experience and engagement only to be experienced at CrypCade Ecosystem.

CrypCade is an Entertainment Ecosystem designed to benefit both user and the platform.
By making a deposit and playing games on CrypCade, users mine CADE tokens that can be claimed and will be sent to user's wallet automatically upon claiming.

Users can freeze CADE tokens in order to gain dividends from the dividend pool. The dividend pool increases with player's losses on in-house games A percentage of partners' games losses also feed into the pool. Wins are credited from the dividend pool.

Dividends are automatically distributed daily to all frozen tokens, Every night at 0:00GMT and are credited to users' wallets upon redeem. Dividends have an expiration period that is mentioned in the Dividends page. Failing to redeem the dividend during this period will result in loss of this dividend.

Dividend distribution:
15% - users
5% - team
5% - reserve
75% - rolls over to the next day's dividends

Players are able to play with the redeemed dividends if so decided and mine more CADE in the process, or withdraw them to the external wallet and end the cycle.

Our Vision

Multifunctionality is at our core, which allows the CrypCade matrix to exist and serve as part of our main aims in every milestone.

With its high emphasis on large throughput with low transaction costs allowing for a very high volume of both users accessing the network, the TRON protocol and Matic.Network allow CrypCade eco-system to flourish and facilitate a large user input/ output while achieving widespread adoption.

CrypCade ensures to use the cutting edge of blockchain gaming technology to introduce outside and facilitate current users to allow easy interaction between UI and user for a seamless, enjoyable experience on the CrypCade Entertainment Systems.

CrypCade Online Systems boasts high speed, instant Withdrawals/ Deposits using latest and most secure web3 API technology without manual outside interference.
All payments are recorded and are Blockchain-Based.

Multicurrency Wallet Support allows for future development and integration of Multiple Payment Types to unrestrict and expand further development on CrypCade.

CADE Token

CADE token is at the heart of the CrypCade platform.

Through effectively proven token mining economy for sustained growth and anticipation of user influx,CADE token allows powerful DApps to be built on the CrypCade platform for easy integration and release.
CADE token boosts our multifunctionality , purposely enabling user to “own” platform stakes as the platform steams ahead , creating a sustainable and economic environment.

How it works

General mechanics of token mining has been used on multiple platforms.

In CrypCade when a user makes a bet within the gaming environment, CADE token mining occurs simultaneously which will be automatically credited to the user’s wallet.
CADE tokens mined within the CrypCade gaming environment are locked within a smart contract.Users will need to withdraw CADE tokens from the smart contract to the user’s wallet, where it can be frozen/staked.
Access to a share of the Dividend Pool translating into daily passive income (variable upon daily Dividend Pool size).

CrypCade.io is 100% Provably Fair using the sha256 algorithim.

Only few survive to be the best games we can offer to our users ,

Currently in development in our Arcade games are a mixture of High Graphic and Low-Res , some of the concepts we have are FPS , Anti-Grav Racing, 2d-Side scollers and a few other types to mention a few.
Our arcade games will be custom made by 3rd party developers, Licensed Arcade Emulators and Our in house CrypCade Studios , Currently all games on the CrypArcade are deisgned and built by CrypCade Studios using Unreal Engine ,Unity,Phaser, Custom tool-kit and our custom SDK.
While CrypCasino caters to our high-risk, thrill-seeking players, CrypArcade is based on skilled gamers, offering classic arcade games as well as high-graphic PvP games and tournaments. 
Check out our LIVE tournaments and hop on the CrypCade train!


How to: check your bets for Fairness on CrypCade.io

https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5268283.msg54980122#msg54980122

CrypCade.io X Matic.Network

https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5268277.msg54979998#msg54979998


CrypCade.io

grants.title: The Defiant
grants.description:
The Defiant is the only news platform focusing on decentralized finance. It serves thousands of readers every day and it's on its way to becoming the media company the space needs. 

*The financial system is being rebuilt and this revolution needs quality journalism.*

Round 5 & 6 Results

I participated in Rounds 5 & 6 with the goal of scaling up The Defiant's team. Generous contributions allowed me to do so and I was able to compensate amazing contributors for their work. Part of my goal was also to launch a Defiant website and DeFi data dashboard, which is in the works and will be launched in the coming weeks.

Round 7 Goals

With <3,
Cami

grants.title: Ethereum Magicians
grants.description:
Updated on September 15, 2020 for Round 7!

The Fellowship of Ethereum Magicians is a community of contributors to Ethereum technology, whether moving the protocol forward , developing smart contract standards, or improving communications in the wider community. A key part of the workflow is for Ethereum core devs, dapp devs, researchers, and other stakeholders, to get feedback on proposals, known as EIPs. This happens in conference calls, in-person, in chat channels, or on the Magicians' Forum.

Until Spring, 2020, Magicians organized in-person meetings and work sessions during Ethereum community conferences. Due to the pandemic and economic crisis, we have transitioned over to a virtual format for discussions, coordinating with other Ethereum-related groups who are doing the same. In July, 2020 we conducted a live experiment using the Gather platform and Zoom, an approach we will continue to improve on.

The ongoing benefit that we bring to the community is that our work empowers decision-makers to gather feedback, and encourages developers and researchers to collaborate closely via the Magicians' Forum. This helps make Ethereum the best technology that it can be!

Funds received will be managed by members of the Operations Ring, a group which manages resources for the Fellowship of Ethereum Magicians, organizes events, and maintains the Forum. Your donation will be used to organize upcoming events, operate and organize, and pay for maintaining and moderating the Forum.

All contributions are highly appreciated 🙏

grants.title: Bankless
grants.description:
Bankless is on a mission to onboard millions of people into living their financial lives on Ethereum. The DeFi ecosystem returns sovereignty and control back into the hands of the individual, and away from top-down authority and rent-seeking middleman. 
 
But, it’s confusing and moves really fast. Education and knowledge is the key to unlocking the power of DeFi to the average individual. There is lots of wealth to be made in this industry, and if this wealth is only accessible to the hyper-connected and highly-skilled, then that wealth will be concentrated rather than diffuse. 
 
Bankless tackles this in a number of different ways:

Newsletter - A daily newsletter consisting of tactics, news, and narrative to orient and engage the world into becoming crypto-native
 
Podcast - A primary source of information from the leading minds directly to the ears of thousands
 
YouTube - For the audio/visual learners, quick-hitting and fast-paced content that strives to keep up with DeFi.

The work is paying off. Over 13k people subscribe to the newsletter, our podcast reaches over 100k downloads every month, and our Getting Started with Bankless Guide has already reach 1 million views! 

GITCOIN ROUNDS

The last two Gitcoin Rounds allowed us grow our Video and International content. As a result, the Bankless YouTube has hit 7,000 subscribers, and Bankless France community is alive and well with over 500 subscribers. We are currently working with an animator to produce visual tactic guides to work alongside our newsletter. Thank you for helping with this effort!
 
WHAT WE'LL DO WITH THIS ROUND
 
Website - Our initial BanklessHQ website needs we major revamp! We want to turn it into a central hub for the various wings of Bankless.

Subnewsletters - The Bankless program is turned for general DeFi education, but we want to cover both beginner topics and deep niches in subnewsletters.

Squad Fund - Writers, animators, meme artists, videographers...they all deserve to be paid! We want to create a fund set aside for a talented squad of freelancers who produce content for the Bankless Nation. 

Multilingual - Ethereum knows no borders, yet the world is still fractured into various languages. With further funding, we can accelerate the growth of the Ethereum ecosystem by being able to reproduce all Bankless content into various different languages. 
 
Every DAI you give helps us get Bankless to more people.
 
Let's help the world go bankless.
 
Thank you for your support. This community is truly incredible. 

-RSA

grants.title: Ethereum on ARM
grants.description:
Run your own Ethereum 1.0 / 2.0 node on ARM devices (such as Raspberry Pi 4) just by flashing the MicroSD Card.

Ethereum on ARM provides custom Ubuntu Linux images for Raspberry Pi 4 , NanoPC-T4 and RockPro64 boards that run Ethereum 1.0 clients (Geth, Nethermind, Besu and OpenEthereum) and Ethereum 2.0 clients (Prysm, Lighthouse, Teku and Nimbus). It automatically turns these ARM devices into a full Ethereum 1.0 or 2.0 node.

Images take care of all the necessary steps, from setting up the environment and formatting the SSD disk to installing and running the Ethereum software as well as synchronizing the blockchain.

For an Eth1.0 node, all you need to do is flash the MicroSD card, plug in an ethernet cable, connect the SSD disk and turn on the device.

For an Eth2.0 node you need to perform some minor tasks (choose and starting a client and activate the validator) in order to join enable the validator.

Last Reddit post Eth1.0 image (Raspberry Pi 4)

https://www.reddit.com/r/ethereum/comments/gf3nhg/ethereum_on_arm_raspberry_pi_4_images_release

Last Reddit post Eth2.0 image (Raspberry Pi 4)

https://www.reddit.com/r/ethereum/comments/ikgp1z/ethereum_on_arm_new_eth20_raspberry_pi_4_image

Our repositories:

Raspberry Pi 4: https://github.com/diglos/pi-gen
NanoPC-T4 & Rockpro64: https://github.com/diglos/userpatches

Check our twitter account for updates

https://twitter.com/EthereumOnARM

grants.title: Umbra:  Privacy Preserving Stealth Payments
grants.description:
What is Umbra?

As a protocol, Umbra defines a simple set of standards, coupled with a singleton smart contract instance, to enable stealth addresses on Ethereum. With a stealth address, a payer can send Ether or ERC20 tokens to an address controlled by the receiver, but no one except the two parties know who that receiver is. 

On chain, the transaction looks like a simple transfer to an otherwise unused address on the Ethereum network. Off chain, the sender has used a public key published by the receiver using ENS to generate the new address. By encrypting the data used to generate the address, and announcing it via the Umbra smart contract, the sender can let the receiver know they’ve sent them a payment to a new stealth address. Only the receiver can generate the private key needed to withdraw the funds.

By leveraging Gas Station Network and Uniswap, Umbra enables withdrawers to pay for gas using the tokens they’ve received. This avoids the need to fund stealth addresses with Ether before withdrawing.

Advantages of Umbra

Umbra allows arbitrary amounts to be sent, since there is no need for inputs and outputs to be uniform.
Umbra does not require the receiver to wait to withdraw funds— as soon as they're sent, they can be withdrawn to any address the receiver chooses.
Umbra ensures only the receiver can withdraw the funds once they're sent. The sender does not hold the private key of the receiving address.
Umbra uses significantly less gas, as it does not require the verification of any advanced cryptography on chains. All transactions are simple transfers.
Umbra enables ETH and arbitrary ERC20 tokens to be transferred privately. You're not dependent on a large anonymity set developing for each token.

Sample Use Case

Alice owns a business and hires Bob to subcontract for her. She agrees to pay Bob 1,000 Dai/week for his work.

The first time Bob visits the Umbra app, he sets up his account, enabling hime to be paid privately. Alice uses Umbra to send 1,000 Dai to Bob each week— she only needs to know his ENS address

On chain, we see Alice pays 1,000 Dai to a different and otherwise empty address each week. Behind the scenes, Bob controls the keys to each of these addresses via Umbra, but nobody else knows as much.

Bob uses Umbra to withdraw his 1,000 Dai each week. He only needs to provide an address to send it to. Obviously, it's best for him to use an address that's not tied to his identity. He usually chooses to send it straight to an exchange, where he sells it for fiat as needed.

Because Umbra uses Gas Station Network and Uniswap, Bob doesn't have to fund the stealth address with Ether to withdraw his Dai. He can pay for gas with the Dai itself. He can also swap directly to any token of his choice, as long as there's a trading pair available on Uniswap.

How Does it Work?

Below is a high level description of the mechanics of the Umbra protocol:

Users publish signed messages to ENS text records to reveal their Umbra public key. This public key is derived from a random private key specifically generated for use with Umbra.
A payer uses this public key, plus some randomly generated data, to create a new 'stealth' address.
The payer encrypts the random data with the receiver's public key.
The payer sends the funds to the shielded address and sends the encrypted message to Umbra's smart contract. The contract broadcasts the encrypted message as an Event.
The receiver scans the encrypted messages broadcast by the Umbra contract until they find one they can decrypt with their private key.
The receiver uses the contents of the encrypted message, plus their private key, to generate the private key of the stealth address.
The receiver uses the private key of the stealth address to sign a withdrawal transaction, sending the ETH or tokens to the address of their choice.
Optionally, the withdrawal transaction is broadcast via Gas Station Network transaction relayers, obviating the need to fund the stealth address to access tokens. The Umbra contracts swap some of the tokens via Uniswap to pay the GSN relayer for gas.

What is the project's status?

NEW: A functional version of the project is available at ropsten.umbra.cash. We hope to bring the protocol to mainnet in the coming months, so your contributions will go primarily towards helping us fund a full security audit!

More Information
Twitter
Telegram
Blog post
GitHub

grants.title: WhalerDAO
grants.description:
What is WhalerDAO?
We fight DeFi whales to save the world.

WhalerDAO is a community of builders, researchers, legal experts, and community influencers who are dedicated to help solve the plethora of problems that the world is facing, using the power of blockchain and decentralized finance (DeFi).

We call ourselves whalers, because we intend to take the control of DeFi protocols away from the rich & powerful “whales” and give it into the hands of the people, which is necessary for preventing DeFi from becoming just another tool for the rich to get even richer.
The WhalerDAO Manifesto
The WhalerDAO Blog
Our Discord community

What we do?
Influence - We collaborate with the various DeFi protocols to use governance as an agent for positive sum impact, transitioning from plutocracy to democracy and convincing the communities that DeFi should be used for funding charitable causes. 

Develop - We develop useful tools for the DeFi community to understand how governance power is distributed and how votes are decided.

Research - We do research into novel models of governance and token distribution that prevent the domination of rich & powerful groups and individuals, such as Conviction Voting, Quadratic Voting, Quadratic Funding, and the Windfall Clause 2.

Tree
TREE is the first initiative of WhalerDAO to create a DeFi protocol that benefits charitable causes. 

The value created by TREE will is allocated to several pools, one being a Charity Pool. TREE also serves as the Governance Token of the TREE Charity Pool, meaning TREE holders receive a vote in how the Charity Fund is allocated to each Charity.

Resource on TREE:
Intro Blog Post
Smart Contracts

Goals of our Grant:
So far we are completely self funding. We have launched a DAO on IDChain and have built the Smart Contracts for TREE. Before deploying TREE, we'd like to have the contracts audited first to reduce risk to TREE holders.

WhalerDAO plans for utilizing funding: 
Our plan is to use the donations to help pay for a security audit of the smart contracts used in our first project TREE, an elastic supply token that generates funding for charities. 

The donations we receive in excess will directly fund the charity treasury used by TREE, and will eventually be paid out to charities as decided by TREE holders using Conviction Voting.


If you also believe that we should be working towards how to use DeFi for good, help the ecosystem and fund our grant. This is a community driven project, so we're reaching out to you the community for help.

If you want to connect with us or learn more, come check out our Discord and Twitter.

grants.title: Meta Gamma Delta - Panvala League
grants.description:
Meta Gamma Delta’s Panvala League Community Goal of Funding Women-Led Projects 

This outlines Meta Gamma Delta’s mission, its participation in Panvala League and how MGD’s members will be allocating these funds in their upcoming internal grants round to support women-led projects.

The funds raised via this Panvala League Communities matching round will follow the same process outlined to distribute other funds within the MGD treasury, learn more: https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1EwCZSf5RonFZOlcpsMAxPqfMoreXYOvGFK6asdGOFTc/edit?usp=sharing
